body: Hi Alejandro, Output of DecomposeZone is a Grasshopper geometry and not a Honeybee object, so when you connect it to runDaylightAnalysis component it won't be exported to rad file. I used importRAD to import the file back and see what is going on. As you can see only shading surface gets exported. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/KzOvBNTGFEGlXg7Y27-HSwl*fFiVLo1q638tLsDw1jTXGzXztmHlAaJGDj8fNTaJ6v9PEZP*xOnFjpaDDuPqotw*63-Brfkh/HBObjects.png) Hope it helps, Mostapha PS: I understand that it may make more sense to change outputs of DecomposeZoneBasedOnType to be HBSurfaces and not Breps. Your current workflow should have worked. I added an issue to make the change: [https://github.com/mostaphaRoudsari/Honeybee/issues/235](https://github.com/mostaphaRoudsari/Honeybee/issues/235)
